exo.phrase: The end of year sales seminar will be be held on ________ Satuday the 12th or Sunday the 13th

caption: Either / or - used in a sentence in the affirmative sense when referring to a choice between two possibilities

exo.phrase: The management of City Cable is _______ sorry for the interruption of services on Saturday.

caption: Deeply sorry is a formal way to express regret

exo.phrase: Mr. and Mrs. Spellborn will be joining the party late due to _____ son's school play.

caption: Their is used to show possession. It is just like my, your, his, her, its, and our.

exo.phrase: The software she _________ at the trade fair last week did not come with a manual.

caption: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past. Sometimes, the speaker may not actually mention the specific time, but they do have one specific time in mind.

exo.phrase: The last ________ for the new position did very poorly on his interview.

caption: Applicant is the person, applying is the action and application is the 'object'
